P000880: 恒河上優婆夷
P000881: The Mahāyāna Sūtra entitled "The Questions of Gaṅgottarā"

P000880: 會第三十一  大唐三藏菩提流志奉　詔譯
P000881: Chapter Thirty-One of the Exalted Mahāratnakūṭa Dharmaparyāya in One Hundred Thousand Chapters: “Explanation of the Questions of Gaṅgottarā”. Half a fascicle.1
In the language of India: Ārya Gaṅgottaraparipṛcchā nāma mahāyānasūtra
Homage to all Buddhas and Bodhisatvas!2

P000880: 如是我聞。一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
P000881: This is what I have heard: Once, the Blessed One was staying in Jeta's Grove, in the pleasure garden donated by Anāthapiṇḍada.

P000880: 時舍衛城有優婆夷。名恒河上。
P000881: At that time, a laywoman by the name of Gaṅgottarā was living in the great city of Śrāvastī.

P000880: 從其住處來詣佛所。頂禮佛足退坐一面。
P000881: One day, the laywoman Gaṅgottarā left Śrāvastī and went to Jeta's Grove, to Anāthapiṇḍada's pleasure garden. Upon arriving, she saluted the Blessed One by placing her head at his feet, and sat down to one side.

P000880: 爾時世尊問恒河上。汝從何來。
P000881: When she had sat down to one side, the Blessed One, although he already knew the answer, asked the laywoman Gaṅgottarā: Where have you come from, Gaṅgottarā?

P000880: 彼優婆夷。即白佛言。世尊。若問化人汝從何來。如是問者當云何答。
P000881: Gaṅgottarā answered: Blessed One, if someone asked a magically conjured being, “Where have you come from?”, what would the answer be?

P000879: བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་། གང་གཱའི་མཆོག་སྤྲུལ་པ་ལ་ནི་འགྲེང་བ་མེད་། འདུག་པ་མེད་། ཉལ་བ་མེད་། འོང་བ་མེད་། འགྲོ་བ་མེད་། འཆི་འཕོ་མེད་། སྐྱེ་བ་མེད་ན་འདི་ནས་འོངས་སོ་ཞེས་དེ་ཅི་ཞིག་སྟོན་པར་འགྱུར་།
P000880: 世尊告言。夫化人者。無有往來。亦無生滅。云何當說有所從來。
P000881: The Blessed One replied: A magical being does not stand, does not sit, does not lie down, does not come, does not go, does not die and is not born.  How then can anyone say that they have come from somewhere?

P000880: 又問諸法豈不皆如化耶。
P000881: Gaṅgottarā continued: Blessed One, aren't all phenomena like magical beings?

P000880: 佛言。如是如是。如汝所說。
P000881: Exactly, Gaṅgottarā, he replied.

P000880: 恒河上言。若一切法皆如化者。云何問言汝從何來。
P000881: If all phenomena are like magical beings, Blessed One, then why ask “Where have you come from, Gaṅgottarā?”, she responded.

P000879: བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་། གང་གཱའི་མཆོག་སྤྲུལ་པ་ནི་ངན་སོང་དུ་མི་འགྲོ་། མཐོ་རིས་སུ་མི་འགྲོ་། ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་མི་འགྲོ་ན་ཅི་གང་གཱའི་མཆོག་ཀྱང་ངན་སོང་དུ་མི་འགྲོ་། མཐོ་རིས་སུ་མི་འགྲོ་། ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན ༼༤༽ ལས་འདས་པར་མི་འགྲོ་འམ་། གང་གཱའི་མཆོག་གིས་གསོལ་པ་། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གལ་ཏེ་བདག་གིས་དགེ་བསྙེན་མ་གང་གཱའི་མཆོག་སྤྲུལ་པའི་རང་བཞིན་ལས་གཞན་ལགས་པར་མཐོང་ན་ནི་དགེ་བསྙེན་མ་གང་གཱའི་མཆོག་ངན་སོང་དུ་མཆི་བ་འམ་མཐོ་རིས་སུ་མཆི་བ ༼༥༽ འམ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་མཆི་བ་མ་ལགས་སོ་ཞེས་བདག་སྤྲུལ་པ་དང་བསྟུན་དུ་ཡང་མི་རུང་ལགས་ན་།
P000880: 世尊告曰。是幻化人不往惡趣。不生天上。不證涅槃。恒河上。汝亦爾耶。  白言。我若見身異於幻化。乃可說言。往善惡趣。證於涅槃。我不見身異於幻化。云何說言。往諸惡趣乃至涅槃。
P000881: The Blessed One said: Gaṅgottarā, a magical being does not go to the realms of misery, nor to the heavenly realms, nor to parinirvāṇa. Do you too then, Gaṅgottarā, not go to the lower realms, nor to the heavenly realms, nor to parinirvāṇa?  Gaṅgottarā answered: Blessed One, if I were to see myself as being anything other than a magical creation, and then were to say that I, the laywoman Gaṅgottarā, do not go to the lower realms, nor to the heavenly realms, nor to parinirvāṇa, then it would not be correct to say that I was like a magically created being.

P000880: 復次世尊。如涅槃性。畢竟不復生善惡趣及般涅槃。我觀己身亦復如是。
P000881: Blessed One, I don't see Gaṅgottarā as being anything other than a magical creation. That being the case, Blessed One, how can I maintain that the laywoman Gaṅgottarā goes to lower realms, to heavenly realms, to parinirvāṇa?

P000880: 佛言。汝豈不趣涅槃界耶。恒河上言。如以此問問無生者。應云何答。佛言。無生者即涅槃也。Chinese needs to be checked here and for the next few lines of Tibetan.
P000881: If that is the case, Blessed One, and if fluctuation, conceit, agitation, and mental proliferation exist, then how can anyone think that they go to lower realms, to heavenly realms, to parinirvāṇa?
Blessed One, nirvāṇa-nature never goes to the lower realms or to the heavenly realms, and never realizes parinirvāṇa. I, Blessed One, the laywoman Gaṅgottarā, also possess such a nature.
The Blessed One said: Gaṅgottarā, haven't you yourself set out for parinirvāṇa?
She answered: Blessed One, if someone asks the unborn “Haven't you set out for parinirvāṇa”, what would the answer be?
The Blessed One replied: Gaṅgottarā, since the unborn is a synonym for nirvāṇa, then what can the answer be?

P000880: 恒河上言。諸法豈不皆同涅槃。  佛言。如是如是。
P000881: Gaṅgottarā answered: Blessed One, are all phenomena the same as nirvāṇa?  He said: Exactly, Gaṅgottarā. All phenomena are the same as nirvāṇa.

P000880: 世尊。若一切法同涅槃者。云何問言。汝豈不趣涅槃界耶。
P000881: She said: Blessed One, if all phenomena are the same as nirvāṇa, why ask “Haven't you yourself set out for nirvāṇa?”

P000880: 復次世尊。譬如化人。謂化人曰。汝豈不趣涅槃界耶。彼於是問。當云何答。
P000881: Blessed One, if someone asked a magical being, “Haven't you yourself set out for nirvāṇa?”, what could the answer be?

P000880: 世尊告言。此所問者無有攀緣。
P000881: The Blessed One said: Gaṅgottarā, this question has no foundation.

P000880: 恒河上言。如來豈以有所攀緣而致斯問。
P000881: She said: Blessed One, are you making a statement which has a foundation?

P000880: 世尊告言。然我所問亦無攀緣。但為此會。有善男子及善女人。應可成熟故發斯問。
P000881: He said: Gaṅgottarā, this question has indeed no foundation. Nonetheless, I ask this question because it will be of great benefit to the noble sons and noble daughters who are gathered here in this assembly.

P000880: 何以故。如來於彼諸法。名字猶不可得。何有諸法及彼能趣般涅槃者。
P000881: Why? If the Tathāgata had not realized the way things are, Gaṅgottarā, then phenomena would still arise in his nirvāṇa.

P000880: 恒河上言。若如是者。云何為菩提故積集善根。
P000881: She said: If the Blessed One had not realized the way things are, and phenomena were still arising, then how could the Blessed One have accomplished the roots of virtue in order to attain awakening.

P000880: 若諸菩薩及彼善根。皆不可得。積集之時即無心故。非積集時亦復如是。  恒河上言。所說無心欲明何義。
P000881: The Blessed One responded: Gaṅgottarā, that which has perception can not be a root of virtue. When a bodhisatva accomplishes roots of virtue, he does not abandon inconceivability.  When he does not accomplish roots of virtue, he still does not abandon inconceivability.

P000880: 世尊告曰。此法非思惟之所能知。亦非思惟之所能得。
P000881: She asked: Blessed One, the inconceivable is called "inconceivable". Why is it inconceivable?

P000880: 何以故。此中心尚不可得。
P000881: The Blessed One said: This Dharma is not attained by the mind, the mind cannot attain it.

P000880: 何況心所生法。以心不可得。是即說名不思議處。
P000881: Why? How can phenomena arise in the mind when the mind itself can not be perceived? Gaṅgottarā, the fact that the mind has no perception is called "the inconceivable continuum".

P000880: 此不思議處。無得無證非染非淨。
P000881: The continuum which is inconceivable can not be attained, can not be understood, can not be known, can not be realized. It is not something that can be attained, it does not have kleśas, it is not fully purified.

P000880: 何以故。如來常說一切諸法。猶如虛空無罣礙故。
P000881: How is that? Gaṅgottara, in this way the tathāgata certainly understands that all dharmas are like space. Gaṅgottara, all dharmas, like space, does not obstruct.

P000879: གསོལ་པ་། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གལ་ཏེ་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད ༼༧༽ ནམ་མཁའ་དང་མཚུངས་པ་གཉེན་པོ་མ་མཆིས་པ་ལགས་ན་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་གཟུགས་ཞེས་བཏགས་པ་དང་། ཚོར་བ་དང་། འདུ་ཤེས་དང་། འདུ་བྱེད་རྣམས་དང་རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་པ་ཞེས་བཏགས་པ་དང་། ཕུང་པོ་རྣམས་དང་། ཁམས་རྣམས་དང་། སྐྱེ་མཆེད ༼༢༢༤ཨ༡༽ རྣམས་དང་། རྟེན་ཅིང་འབྲེལ་བར་འབྱུང་བ་དང་། ཟག་པ་དང་བཅས་པ་དང་། ཟག་པ་མ་མཆིས་པ་དང་། ཀུན་ནས་ཉོན་མོངས་པ་དང་། རྣམ་པར་བྱང་བ་དང་། འཁོར་བ་དང་། མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པ་ཞེས་བཏགས་པ་ཇི་ལྟ་བུ་ལགས་༎ ༼༢༽
P000880: 恒河上言。若一切法如虛空者。云何世尊。說有諸色受想行識。及於界處十二因緣。有漏無漏。是染是淨。生死涅槃。
P000881: She said: Blessed One, if all dharmas is equal to space, being without obstruction, then why does the Blessed One designate form (rūpa), feeling (vedanā), perception (saṃjñā), formation (samskāra), consciousness (vijñāna), the aggregates, the elements, the sense-bases, dependent arising, with pollution, without pollution, defilement, purification (vyavadāna), saṃsāra, nirvāṇa? How can this be?

P000880: 佛告恒河上。譬如說我雖有言說。而實無有我相可得。我說諸色。實亦無有色相可得。
P000881: The Blessed One said: Gaṅgottarā, as an example: I designate “self, self”, however, I do not perceive anything as real. Similarly, Gaṅgottara, I designate form, but there is not any kind of form perceived.

P000880: 乃至涅槃亦復如是。
P000881: Likewise, I designate feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, but do not perceive any consciousness as real.

P000879: ཕུང་པོ་རྣམས་དང་། ཁམས་རྣམས་དང་། སྐྱེ་མཆེད་རྣམས་དང་། རྟེན་ཅིང་འབྲེལ་བར་འབྱུང་བ་དང་། ཟག་པ་དང་བཅས་པ་དང་། ཟག་པ་མེད་པ་དང་། ༼༤༽ ཀུན་ནས་ཉོན་མོངས་པ་དང་། རྣམ་པར་བྱང་བ་དང་། འཁོར་བ་དང་། མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ཡང་ངས་བཏགས་ཏེ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པ་གང་ཡང་མི་དམིགས་སོ་༎
P000881: Skandhas, elements, sense-sources, dependent origination, pollution, non-pollution, defilements, purification, saṃsāra, nirvāṇa is designated, but I do not perceive it as anything real.

P000880: 又如陽焰無水可得。
P000881: Gaṅgottara, as an example, in the mirage I do not perceive the existence or non-existence of water.

P000880: 我說諸色乃至涅槃。亦復如是。See next two sections also. Chinese abbreviates what is given in full in Tibetan.
P000881: Gaṅgottara, likewise, even though I designate form there is no real form perceived.

P000880: See above.
P000881: Even though I designate feeling, perception, formation, consciousness, I do not perceive consciousness as anything real.

P000879: ཕུང་པོ་རྣམས་དང་། ཁམས ༼༦༽ རྣམས་དང་། སྐྱེ་མཆེད་རྣམས་དང་། རྟེན་ཅིང་འབྲེལ་བར་འབྱུང་བ་དང་། ཟག་པ་དང་བཅས་པ་དང་། ཟག་པ་མེད་པ་དང་། ཀུན་ནས་ཉོན་མོངས་པ་དང་། རྣམ་པར་བྱང་བ་དང་། འཁོར་བ་དང་། མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བར་ངས་བཏགས་ཀྱང་དོན་དམ་པར་ན་དེ ༼༧༽ དག་ཐམས་ཅད་མེད་ཅིང་མི་དམིགས་སོ་༎
P000880: See above.
P000881: Even though I designate skandhas, elements, sense-sources, dependent origination, pollution, non-pollution, defilements, purification, saṃsāra, nirvāṇa, ultimately all these things are not there and are not perceived.

P000880: 恒河上。於我法中修梵行者。見一切法皆無所得。乃可說名真修梵行。
P000881: Gaṅgottarā, whoever is not attached to the dharma and practices the holy life, such a one is one who dwells in the holy life, in the well-explained dharmavinaya.

P000880: 增上慢者說有所得。是則不名住真梵行。我說如是。
P000881: Gaṅgottarā, the ones who dwell in excessive pride in their practice of the holy life, those do not keep the holy life completely pure. So I declare.

P000880: 增上慢人。聞此深法生大驚疑。
P000881: Those who do not keep the holy life completely pure become scared when they hear this profound dharma which cuts through.

P000879: དེ་དག་སྐྱེ་བ་དང་། ༼༢༽ རྒ་བ་དང་། ན་བ་དང་། འཆི་བ་དང་། མྱ་ངན་དང་། སྨྲེ་སྔགས་འདོན་པ་དང་། སྡུག་བསྔལ་པ་དང་། ཡིད་མི་བདེ་བ་དང་། འཁྲུག་པ་རྣམས་ལས་ཡོངས་སུ་མི་འགྲོལ་ཏེ་། དེ་དག་ནི་སྡུག་བསྔལ་གྱི་སྐལ་བ་ཅན་དུ་འགྱུར་རོ་ཞེས་ང་སྨྲའོ་༎
P000880: 不能解脫生老病死憂悲苦惱。
P000881: They are not liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, pain, lamentation, suffering, unease, disturbance. They will have their share of suffering. So I declare.

P000880: 恒河上。若我滅後。有能宣說如是甚深斷流轉法。有愚癡輩由惡見故。於是法師生瞋害心。以是因緣墮諸地獄。
P000881: Gaṅgottara, now or after I pass away, those confused people who towards those who teach such a profound dharma that cuts off the stream produce the idea of murdering them, those stupid people have taken the wrong way and have produced the rage of murder and will go to the miserable states.

P000880: 恒河上言。如佛所說斷流轉法。以何義故。名為斷流轉。
P000881: Gaṅgottara said: Blessed One, you say “stream-chopping, stream-chopping”, why do you call it stream-chopping?

P000879: བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་། གང་གཱའི་མཆོག་ཆོས་འདི་ནི་རྒྱུད་གཅད་པའམ་། དབྱེ་བ་འམ་། རྣམ ༼༥༽ པར་གཞིག་པ་མ་ཡིན་ཏེ་། དེའི་ཕྱིར་རྒྱུད་ཆད་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་སྟེ་། འདི་ནི་ཡང་དག་པའི་མཐའ་ཞེས་བྱ་། བསམ་གྱིས་མི་ཁྱབ་པའི་རྒྱུད་ཅེས་བྱའོ་༎
P000880: 世尊告言。斷流轉者。所謂實際不思議界。此法不可穿鑿沮壞。是故說名斷流轉法。
P000881: The Blessed One said: Gaṅgottara, this is not cutting off, this is not differentiation, this is not destruction.  That is why it's called destruction.  That is why it is the absolute extreme of existence.  This is the inconceivable continuum.

P000880: 爾時世尊。凞怡微笑。
P000881: Then the Blessed One smiled.

P000879: དེ་ནས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱི་ཞལ་གྱི་སྒོ་ནས་འོད་ཟེར་ཁ ༼༦༽ དོག་སྣ་ཚོགས་ཁ་དོག་དུ་མ་འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ་། སྔོན་པོ་དང་། སེར་པོ་དང་། དམར་པོ་དང་། དཀར་པོ་དང་། བཙོད་ཀ་དང་། ཤེལ་དང་། དངུལ་གྱི་ཁ་དོག་ལྟ་བུ་དག་བྱུང་ནས་དེ་དག་གིས་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་མཐའ་ཡས་མུ་མེད་པ་དག་སྣང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ་འོད་ཀྱིས་ཁྱབ་པར ༼༧༽ བྱས་ནས་ཚངས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་བར་དུ་མངོན་པར་བྱུང་སྟེ་སླར་ལོག་ནས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱི་ཞལ་གྱི་སྒོར་ནུབ་བོ་༎
P000880: 從其面門放種種光。青黃赤白紅頗梨色。其光普照無量國界。上至梵世還從如來頂上而入。
P000881: Then from the mouth of the Blessed One variegated light, with colours like green, yellow, white, red, crystal, and silver issued forth, and these lights without end, without limit, after having illuminated universes without end and without limit, and having filled them, they rose up to the Brahma heavens.  Then they came back again to their master and disappeared into the mouth of the Blessed One.

P000880: 爾時尊者阿難。見是事已心自念言。如來應正等覺。非無因緣而現微笑。作是念已。即從座起。偏袒右肩右膝著地。合掌向佛。而作是言。
P000881: Then the Venerable Ānanda placed his robe over one shoulder, knelt down on his right knee, and with hands folded towards the Blessed One, he asked the Blessed One this question.

P000880: 以何因緣現此微笑。
P000881: “As Blessed Ones and Tathāgatas do not smile for no reason, what is the reason for smiling?”

P000880: 佛言。我念往昔。有千如來。亦於此處說如是法。彼諸眾會。各各亦有恒河上優婆夷。而為上首。
P000881: The Blessed One said, “Ānanda, it has been directly known by me that here in this place 1000 Tathāgatas taught this turning of the Dharma to laywomen, all of them with the very same name of Gaṅgottara.

P000880: 彼優婆夷及諸大眾。聞是法已皆悉出家。於無餘涅槃而得滅度。
P000881: All of those laywomen, have gone forth and have then been released in that element of release that is without remainder.”

P000880: 阿難白佛言。當何名此經。我等云何受持。
P000881: Then the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, what is the name of this Dharma teaching, and how should we remember it?”

P000880: 佛言。此經名為離垢清淨。以是名字汝當受持。
P000881: The Blessed One answered, “This Dharma talk is called “Without Impurity”, and this is how it should be remembered.”

P000880: 說此經時。七百比丘眾。四百比丘尼眾。諸漏永盡心得解脫。
P000881: When this Dharma teaching was given to 700 monks and 400 nuns without any attachment, their minds were completely liberated from the pollutions.

P000880: 爾時欲界諸天子。化作種種天諸妙花而散佛上。作如是言。
P000881: Then the gods of the realm of sensual desire and the god-sons who inhabit the realm of form magically created divine flowers and sandalwood powder, scattered them over the Buddha, and then said,

P000880: 此優婆夷甚為希有。能與如來共相詶對。得無所畏。是人已曾無量佛所。親近供養種諸善根。
P000881: “In the city of Śrāvastī lives a laywoman who was able to have a conversation with the Tathāgata without becoming tired. This is because she has served Victorious Ones of the past, produced the roots of skilfulness, practised the good for a long time, practised the holy life for a long time, paid homage to many Buddhas.  This is wonderful.  This is what we declare.”
The Blessed One said, “That is so, god-sons.  This person has served former Victorious Ones, cultivated roots of skilfulness, and lived the holy life for a long time.”

P000879: བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ནས་། དགེ་བསྙེན་མ་གང་གཱའི་མཆོག་དང་། ལྷ་དང་། མི་དང་ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དང་། དྲི་ཟར་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་ཡི་རངས་ཏེ་། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་གསུངས་པ་ལ་མངོན་པར ༼༢༽ བསྟོད་དོ་༎༎
P000880: 佛說是經已。恒河上優婆夷。及諸天人阿修羅乾闥婆等。聞佛所說。皆大歡喜。信受奉行。
P000881: When the Blessed One had pronounced this teaching, the laywoman Gaṅgottarā, and the world with its gods, asuras, and gandharvas were delighted, and praised his words highly.

P000880: 大寶積經卷第九十八
P000881: The “Chapter on the Questions of Gaṅgottarā”, Chapter Thirty-one of the hundred thousand chapter Exalted Mahāratnakūṭa Dharmaparyāya, is complete.
Translated, rendered into the new terminology, and established by the Indian preceptors Jinamitra and Dānaśīla, the editor-translator Bhande Ye shes sde, and others.
